channel.title: BBC News - Wales
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Covid: 600,000 patients on NHS Wales waiting lists
item.description: More than 19% of the Welsh population is waiting for treatment, latest figures show.

item.title: More than 600,000 people told to isolate by NHS Covid-19 app
item.description: 618,903 people in England and Wales received self-isolation alerts in the week up to 14 July

item.title: Covid in Wales: Young farmers' club membership halves
item.description: But members are starting to return as Covid rules are relaxed, says the Wales chair.

item.title: Swansea: 3D printed ear would 'transform' girl's life
item.description: Scientists will use human cells and plant-based materials to rebuild an ear for 10-year-old Radiyah.

item.title: Motorcyclist killed in crash on A44 near Aberystwyth
item.description: The motorcyclist died at the scene after crashing with a lorry near Aberystwyth on Wednesday.

item.title: Mills and Sbihi to be Team GB flag bearers in Tokyo
item.description: Sailor Hannah Mills and rower Mohamed Sbihi are chosen to carry the flag for Great Britain at Friday's Tokyo Olympics opening ceremony.

item.title: Climate change: Airbus aims for 'climate-neutral' flights by 2035
item.description: And the wing-maker's Flintshire factory will play a "critical" role, says one senior manager.

item.title: Neath Port Talbot 'cow' row council leader cleared of misconduct
item.description: Rob Jones referred himself to the ombudsman after he was recorded calling a Senedd member a "cow".

item.title: NHS workers in Wales to get 3% pay rise
item.description: One union describes the offer as "bitterly disappointing" compared to the 12.5% it had demanded.

item.title: A55 Anglesey: Man crushed by lorry as he crawled from crash
item.description: Ciaran Michael Murray was seen crawling on the road before being struck by a lorry, inquest hears.

item.title: Springwatch's Iolo Williams angry as sea scooters hit birds
item.description: Springwatch presenter Iolo Williams wants users to require licences and vehicles to carry number plates.

item.title: Covid: Young farmers' clubs lose half their flock in pandemic
item.description: Membership fell from around 4,000 to 2,000 during the pandemic, but is starting to improve.

item.title: Dinosaur footprint found by girl, 4, to go on display
item.description: The discovery by Lily may show how the extinct reptiles kept their feet on the ground.

item.title: Heatwave: Workers struggle to avoid 'unbearable' temperatures
item.description: For some workers, it is impossible to avoid the scorching temperatures during the heatwave.

item.title: Mayhill: ‘Rioters taught my son anger and hatred’
item.description: Adam Romain says his previously loving and calm son has become aggressive after witnessing a riot.

item.title: Heatwave: Stay safe in the sun, says Welsh Ambulance Service
item.description: The ambulance service urges people to take care as it faces a rising number of 999 calls.

item.title: Heatwave: Hot weather closes Pontyclun pub
item.description: Landlord Simon Cole temporarily shuts the Pipeworks Bar after the mercury hit 30.9C.

item.title: John Eustace: Queens Park Rangers assistant boss a contender for Swansea City job
item.description: Queens Park Rangers assistant manager John Eustace is a leading contender to be the next Swansea City boss.

item.title: British and Irish Lions 2021: Captain Alun Wyn Jones reflects on 'surreal' return
item.description: British and Irish Lions captain Alun Wyn Jones reflects on completing a remarkable recovery to lead the tourists against South Africa.

item.title: Steve Cooper: Head coach leaves Swansea City
item.description: Steve Cooper leaves his position as Swansea City's head coach after just over two years in charge.

item.title: Rugby League World Cup: Australia and New Zealand pull out of tournament
item.description: Australia and New Zealand pull out of the Rugby League World Cup because of "player welfare and safety concerns" related to the Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: Osian Roberts says Morocco can be in world's top 20 as he steps down as technical director
item.description: Welsh coach Osian Roberts says Morocco has the potential to be in world football's top 20 as he steps down as technical director.

item.title: Aelodaeth y Ffermwyr Ifanc 'wedi haneru' dros y pandemig
item.description: CFfI Cymru wedi gorfod cynnal digwyddiadau'n rhithiol, ond yn obeithiol y daw aelodau yn ôl.

item.title: Pryder cyflenwad dŵr wrth i bibellau fyrstio naw gwaith
item.description: Mae 'na alw am weithredu wedi i brif bibellau dŵr Gwyddelwern fyrstio naw gwaith ers mis Ebrill.

item.title: 'Trawsnewid' darpariaeth gofal brys yng Nghymru
item.description: Strategaeth newydd Llywodraeth Cymru yn ceisio lleihau faint o bobl sy'n mynd i'r ysbyty am driniaeth.

item.title: Y Cymry fydd yn mynd am aur yn Tokyo
item.description: Catrin Heledd sy'n trafod pwy yw ein gobeithion gorau am fedalau

item.title: Steve Cooper yn gadael ei swydd fel rheolwr Abertawe
item.description: Y gred yw fod y rheolwr wedi bod yn rhwystredig nad oedd wedi gallu cryfhau'r garfan dros yr haf.
